intro: Herpestis micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, tubular flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Herpestis micrantha is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
